title: Definition of Common Pattern
content: What is the 'Common Pattern' in JavaScript object creation?
sampleAnswers: It’s the simplest way of creating objects in JavaScript using object literals or basic functions.
It involves manually defining properties and methods without abstraction.

title: Cons of Common Pattern
content: What is a major drawback of the Common Pattern?
sampleAnswers: It doesn’t scale well because every object must be defined manually.
Code duplication increases with many similar objects.

title: Repetition Problem
content: Why might using the Common Pattern cause problems when creating many similar objects?
sampleAnswers: Because you need to repeat the same properties and methods for each object.
It leads to duplication and makes changes harder to maintain.

title: Debugging Common Pattern
sampleAnswers: The arrow function doesn’t bind `this` properly, so `this.brand` and `this.model` are undefined.
Use a regular function instead of an arrow function.

title: Best Use Case
content: When is it appropriate to use the Common Pattern?
sampleAnswers: For very small apps or scripts where only one or two objects are needed.
When performance and scalability aren’t concerns.

title: Transition to Other Patterns
content: Why do developers often move from the Common Pattern to the Factory Pattern or Constructor Pattern?
sampleAnswers: Because as applications grow, manually creating objects becomes repetitive and hard to maintain.
Factories and constructors provide abstraction and scalability.
